availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Steele (Caldwell County and Lyon County, Kentucky, school teacher)

body.p: Caldwell County and Lyon County, Kentucky, school teacher. Livingston County, Kentucky native. Married to Matilda A. Turley Steele. Father of J. R. Steele, C. E. Steele, G. F. Steele, Mary Steele, Kate Steele, and Jenny Steele. School teacher in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Teacher in Lyon County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 301B-302A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, District 1, p. 12B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994046, Lyon County Births, p. 1.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Lyon County, KY, June 1863, p. 16.
"John B. Steele (1827-1884)," Find A Grave, Memorial #40319697, accessed June 16, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/40319697.
